list.title: BMI.finalize
list.description: Perform tear-down tasks for the model. Perform all tasks that take place after exiting the model's time loop. This typically includes deallocating memory, closing files and printing reports.

list.title: BMI.get_component_name
list.description: Gets name of the component.

list.title: BMI.get_current_time
list.description: Current time of the model

list.title: BMI.get_end_time
list.description: End time of the model

list.title: BMI.get_grid_edge_count
list.description: Get the number of edges in the grid

list.title: BMI.get_grid_edge_nodes
list.description: Get the edge-node connectivity.

list.title: BMI.get_grid_face_count
list.description: Get the number of faces in the grid.

list.title: BMI.get_grid_face_edges
list.description: Get the face-edge connectivity.

list.title: BMI.get_grid_face_nodes
list.description: Get the face-edge connectivity.

list.title: BMI.get_grid_node_count
list.description: Get the number of nodes in the grid.

list.title: BMI.get_grid_nodes_per_face
list.description: Get the face-edge connectivity.

list.title: BMI.get_grid_origin
list.description: Get coordinates for the lower-left corner of the computational grid.

list.title: BMI.get_grid_rank
list.description: Get number of dimensions of the computational grid.

list.title: BMI.get_grid_shape
list.description: Get dimensions of the computational grid

list.title: BMI.get_grid_size
list.description: Get the total number of elements in the computational grid.

list.title: BMI.get_grid_spacing
list.description: Get dimensions of the computational grid

list.title: BMI.get_grid_type
list.description: Get the grid type as a string.

list.title: BMI.get_grid_x
list.description: Get coordinates of grid nodes in the x direction.

list.title: BMI.get_grid_y
list.description: Get coordinates of grid nodes in the y direction.

list.title: BMI.get_grid_z
list.description: Get coordinates of grid nodes in the z direction.

list.title: BMI.get_input_item_count
list.description: Count of a model's input variables.

list.title: BMI.get_input_var_names
list.description: Gets an Array of names for the variables the model can use from other models implementing a BMI.

list.title: BMI.get_output_item_count
list.description: Count of a model's output variables.

list.title: BMI.get_output_var_names
list.description: Gets an Array of names for the variables the model can provide to other models implementing a BMI.

list.title: BMI.get_start_time
list.description: Start time of the model. Model times should be of type float

list.title: BMI.get_time_step
list.description: Current time step of the model. The model time step should be of type Number

list.title: BMI.get_time_units
list.description: Time units of the model

list.title: BMI.get_value
list.description: Get a copy of values of the given variable. This is a method for the model, used to access the model's current state. It returns a copy of a model variable, with the return type, size and rank dependent on the variable.

list.title: BMI.get_value_at_indices
list.description: Get values at particular indices.

list.title: BMI.get_value_ptr
list.description: Get a reference to values of the given variable. This is a method for the model, used to access the model's current state. It returns a reference to a model variable, with the return type, size and rank dependent on the variable.

list.title: BMI.get_var_grid
list.description: Get grid identifier for the given variable.

list.title: BMI.get_var_itemsize
list.description: Provides the size, in bytes, of a single element of the variable

list.title: BMI.get_var_location
list.description: Get the grid element type that the a given variable is defined on. The grid topology can be composed of nodes, edges, and faces. node A point that has a coordinate pair or triplet: the most basic element of the topology. edge A line or curve bounded by two nodes. face A plane or surface enclosed by a set of edges. In a 2D horizontal application one may consider the word “polygon”, but in the hierarchy of elements the word “face” is most common.

list.title: BMI.get_var_nbytes
list.description: The function provides the total amount of memory used to store a variable; i.e., the number of items multiplied by the size of each item

list.title: BMI.get_var_type
list.description: Get data type of the given variable.

list.title: BMI.get_var_units
list.description: Get units of the given variable. Standard unit names, in lower case, should be used, such as "meters" or "seconds". Standard abbreviations, like "m" for meters, are also supported. For variables with compound units, each unit name is separated by a single space, with exponents other than 1 placed immediately after the name, as in "m s-1" for velocity, "W m-2" for an energy flux, or "km2" for an area.

list.title: BMI.initialize
list.description: Perform startup tasks for the model. Perform all tasks that take place before entering the model's time loop, including opening files and initializing the model state. Model inputs are read from a text-based configuration file, specified by "config_file".

list.title: BMI.set_value
list.description: Specify a new value for a model variable. This is the setter for the model, used to change the model's current state. It accepts, through src, a new value for a model variable, with the type, size and rank of src dependent on the variable.

list.title: BMI.set_value_at_indices
list.description: Specify a new value for a model variable at particular indices.

list.title: BMI.update
list.description: Advance model state by one time step. Perform all tasks that take place within one pass through the model's time loop. This typically includes incrementing all of the model's state variables. If the model's state variables don't change in time, then they can be computed by the :function:initialize method and this method can return with no action.

list.title: BMI.update_until
list.description: Advance model state until the given time.

list.title: BMIConfig.configGen
list.description: Creates a configuration steering file to be used on the BMI HydroLang implementation.

list.title: data
list.description: Module for dealing with data.

list.title: data.download
list.description: Download files on different formats, depending on the formatted object. It extends the the transform function to automatically transform the data. The default format

list.title: data.generateDateString
list.description: Creates a date a outof a string.

list.title: data.lowercasing
list.description: Lowercases the keys in an object. Can be nested object with arrays or what not.

list.title: data.recursiveSearch
list.description: Searches for an array with data passed as string.

list.title: data.retrieve
list.description: Main function to retrieve data.

list.title: data.transform
list.description: Convert data types into others based on the premise of having JS objects as primary input.

list.title: data.upload
list.description: Data upload from the user's local storage for analysis.

list.title: data.xml2json
list.description: Recursive function that iteratively converts XML document format to JSON format. Required the XML input to be a JQUERY object parsed from string. Credit: https://stackoverflow.com/a/20861541

list.title: datasources
list.description: Extends the data sources on the framework to the data module.

list.title: datasources.AEMET
list.description: AEMET: API REST from the Spanish Meteorological Service. For more information about the service, please visit: https://opendata.aemet.es/dist/index.html?#!/observacion-convencional/Datos_de_observaci%C3%B3n_Tiempo_actual_1 Note: Different data sources may have different limitations -> E.g., they may limit the # of queries per unit time AEMET requires registration to get KEY and must be included in parameters. The API KEY has format 'api_key'. Dates in format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss

list.title: datasources.ClearCreek
list.description: Data specific for the development of a case study for the implementation of BMI.js standard. This application has been developed and deployed using MRMS-Stage IV data obtained for the IFC HLM model for the Clear Creek in Iowa. The endpoints available are listed below. For more information,please visit: https://ifis.iowafloodcenter.org/ifis/sc/modelplus/ https://agu.confex.com/agu/fm21/meetingapp.cgi/Paper/897497

list.title: datasources.CUAHSI
list.description: CUAHSI available REST endpoints. This collection includes: waterOneFlow, hisCentral and HydroShare

list.title: datasources.CUAHSI.hisCentral
list.description: HIS Central serves as the main functions that can be used for a specific resource. It allows for users to obtain specific data from a resource without the need of manipulation a large chunk of data, but rather, allow a function to query the data. Each function has its own usage and is constrained by the parameters passed within HydroLang functions. More information about HIS Central can be found in the following link: https://his.cuahsi.org/

list.title: datasources.CUAHSI.hydroShare
list.description: HydroShare API, enabling acccess to data resources, examples, models and more hosted within the HydroShare sphere. Swagger example found in the following link:https://www.hydroshare.org/hsapi/

list.title: datasources.CUAHSI.waterOneFlow
list.description:
Data endpoints for the CUAHSI HIS WaterOneFlow services. The services accessed require POST requests through SOAP protocol. The endpoints are compliant with version 1.1 of the service. More information about the request can be found in the following links: https://cuahsi.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/205153157-HydroServer-and-the-WaterOneFlow-Web-Services-API https://hydroportal.cuahsi.org/ipswich/

Includes the following methods

list.title: datasources.EAUK
list.description: Data gov uk: provides API for free datasets from the UK and other parts of the world. For more information about the service, please visit: https://environment.data.gov.uk/apiportal Note: Different data sources may have different limitations Endpoints have a default limit of 500 items. The service does not require an API key, but, size limitations should be considered when downloading data. Moreover, its better to bulk on data if required. The files can be obtained in JSON, CSV or ZIP format. For more information on the historical flooding data, visit: https://environment.data.gov.uk/flood-monitoring/archive Coordinates in WGS84. Dates in format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss

list.title: datasources.EPA
list.description: Data endpoints for the Hydrologic Micro Services from the EPA. HydroLang supports the requests through AJAX calls to the server. https://qed.epa.gov/hms/meteorology/precipitation/data_request/ Please check input/output parameters for more information on the selected requested datas services https://qed.epa.gov/hms/meteorology/precipitation/#output_parameters

list.title: datasources.FEMA
list.description: https://www.fema.gov/openfema-dataset-disaster-declarations-summaries-v2 This API just returns all disaster declarations for US since 1953 -> E.g., they may limit the # of queries per unit time

list.title: datasources.IFIS
list.description: https://ifis.iowafloodcenter.org/ifis/ws/ This API returns data from the IFIS web service.

list.title: datasources.MeteoIT
list.description: MeteoNetwork API: free datasets from the italy and some surrounding places. For more information about the service, please visit: https://www.meteonetwork.it/ Note: Different data sources may have different limitations The service requires the creation of an account and the generation of a new token. For more information on the historical flooding data, visit: http://api.meteonetwork.it/docs/ Dates in format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss

list.title: datasources.MeteoSTAT
list.description: Meteostat data retrieval. Note: Different data sources may have different limitations -> E.g., they may limit the # of queries per unit time The API retrieves all the variables that are measured in a given station. For cleaning up the data, refer to the data module in Hydrolang. For identification of country ISO3 codes, refer to https://unstats.un.org/unsd/methodology/m49/ For referral on formats, please visit https://dev.meteostat.net/getting-started/formats-and-units Dates in format ISO 8601 standard YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS Activation key format and name to is "x-api-key" More info, please visit https://dev.meteostat.net/

list.title: datasources.NOAA
list.description: NOAA API for data retrieval, different application types. Note: Different data sources may have different limitations -> E.g., they may limit the # of queries per unit time NOAA requires registration to get TOKEN and must be included in parameters. https://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/cdo-web/webservices/v2#data Must requests must be less than 1 year. Dates in format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss IMPORTANT: for retrieving more than 25 lines of data, include limit = required number.

list.title: datasources.ProxyServers
list.description: All proxy servers tried and working can be found here. It is a trial/error to see if a specific error might be working per resource.

list.title: datasources.USGS
list.description: https://waterservices.usgs.gov/rest/IV-Service.html This API returns stream stages for US

list.title: datasources.Worldbank
list.description: World Bank API for data retrieval. Handles many types of data depending on the requirements of the user. Note: Different data sources may have different limitations -> E.g., they may limit the # of queries per unit time World Bank does not requires no key, but supports 3 different types of output files. Consider visiting the website for more guidance. https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/902061-climate-data-api For identification of country ISO3 codes, refer to https://unstats.un.org/unsd/methodology/m49/ For identification of basin ISO3 codes, refer to https://github.com/hrbrmstr/basins Dates in format YYYY

list.title: divisor.createForm
list.description: Creates a form appended to the DOM with a button attached to it.

list.title: divisors
list.description: Module for visualization of charts and tables.

list.title: divisors.createDiv
list.description: Creates a div space for rendering all sorts of required divisors.

list.title: divisors.createScript
list.description: Creates a script given a source, JS text and name to be appended to the header.

list.title: divisors.isdivAdded
list.description: Function for verifying if a div has already been added into the document.

list.title: divisors.isScriptAdded
list.description: Function for verifying if a script has been added to the header of the webpage.

list.title: external:D3
list.description: Imports external library D3.

list.title: external:GoogleCharts
list.description: Imports external library Google Charts.

list.title: external:googlemapsapi
list.description: Imports Google Maps API. A key is necessary for usage of the engine.

list.title: external:JQuery
list.description: Import external library JQuery.

list.title: external:leafletosmapi
list.description: Imports Leaflet map engine.

list.title: external:tensorflow
list.description: Import external library TensorFlow.js

list.title: external:tileprov
list.description: Tiles provided by different sources. Please check out each source info to see if there are other requirements needed for usage. All sources included here do not require key, but there are sources with other styles that might be useful. Credits to https://github.com/leaflet-extras/leaflet-providers

list.title: GoogleCharts.googlecdn
list.description: Appends the google charts library to header for usage on charts and tables. CDN currently stable but needs to be verified and updated if required.

list.title: HLclearCreek
list.description: Data module implementation for the Clear Creek HLM case study model Overrides some of the methods implemented in the BMI HydroLang implementation. Extends the HydroLang functional space by inheritance. The instance calls either a data request from EPA precipitation model API's or calls data from an preestablished model for the HLM-C implementation. Provides data from EPA using grided models on an hourly scale. Connects with the USGS gauging station for comparision purposes.

list.title: HLclearCreek.additionalData
list.description: Run if EPA data is to be queried.

list.title: HLclearCreek.dataStep
list.description: Steps through an event given step size.

list.title: HLclearCreek.get_time_step
list.description: Returns the current state of the model. For HLclearCreek is the default time step.

list.title: HLclearCreek.get_value_at_indices
list.description: Obtains the rainfall values at a specific index in the results array, when an index array is passed.

list.title: HLclearCreek.retrieveData
list.description: Method for downloading data from the provided calls for the EPA API. Calls the

list.title: HLclearCreek.retrieveGauge
list.description: Downloads data from the USGS site

list.title: HLclearCreek.spreadGauge
list.description: Spreads the results downloaded from the USGS service to a global variable called gauge

list.title: HLclearCreek.spreadResults
list.description: Grabs the downloaded object to create the links object and parse the dates for each link so they can be in unixtime. Overrides the values of the time used depending on the type of unit used

list.title: HLclearCreek.update
list.description: Update the model until a required time, Depending on the module and function required.

list.title: HLclearCreek.update_until
list.description: Updates a model and function call depending on the requirements of the function and module called.

list.title:
HLclearCreek
Searches and seeks for the name of the links for the analysis.getLinks
HLclearCreek#rainID
list.description: Checks for storm events given dates.

list.title: hydr.dimunithydr
list.description: Generates a hydrograph using various distribution types (gamma, LP3, weibull) for a given duration and time step

list.title: hydro
list.description: Main class used for hydrological analyses.

list.title: hydro.arithmetic
list.description: Computation of aereal mean precipitation for a river basin given it has 2 or more different stations.

list.title: hydro.bucketmodel
list.description: Simple rainfall-runoff analyses over a rainfall dataset given landuse, baseflow and infiltration capacity.It is mainly used for long-term hydrological analysis such as monthly changes. All should be in mm. For more info, refer to https://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.544.5085&rep=rep1&type=pdf

list.title: hydro.dynamicGround1D
list.description: Solves 1D dynamic groundwater simulation using the Crank-Nicolson method Adapted from (Molkentin, 2019)

list.title: hydro.equationsystemsolver
list.description: Solves linear equations in the form Ax = b.

list.title: hydro.floodhydro
list.description: Flooding hydrograph generator using a unit hydrograph, precipitation data and SCS metrics for runoff calculation. If the observed hydrograph option is selected, the precipitation must be dividied in blocks of rainfall in as a 2D array [[date, date, date], [rainf, rainf, rainf]]

list.title: hydro.ground1d
list.description: Solves 1d groundwater steady simulation using gaussian elimination for a static setting. Adapted from (Molkentin, 2019).

list.title: hydro.hyetogen
list.description: Hyetograph generator for a uniformly distributed rainfall event. This function generates a hyetograph for a long-duration storm based on a uniformly distributed rainfall event.

list.title: hydro.matrix
list.description: Creates a matrix of m x n dimensions filled with whatever the user requires. For numerical calculations, fill it with 0s.

list.title: hydro.move
list.description: Moving arrays from one location to another given an index.

list.title: hydro.rainaggr
list.description: Aggregates or dissaggregates rainfall data depending on what the user requires. The date type must be a Javascript string or number and in minutes or hours, but both the aggregation interval require and the data interval should be the same. For aggregation, the interval for aggregation must be larger than the time step. For example, 15 min or 30 min data to be aggregatted every 60 minutes. Intervals must be multiples of the final aggregaiton (2, 4, etc)

list.title: hydro.syntheticalc
list.description: Calculates parameters for the generation of a unit hydrograph based on SCS method, Snyder Unit Hydrograph. All times of concentrations and lags time are calculated in hours

list.title: hydro.thiessen
list.description: Thiessen polygon method for rainfall areal averaging. Calculates the weighted average of point rainfall observations by dividing the study area into polygonal subareas and weighting each observation by the proportion of the total area it contributes to.

list.title: hydro.totalprec
list.description: Arithmetic sum of the values inside an array.

list.title: hydro.unithydrocons
list.description: Unit hydrograph constructor NRCS constructor depending on the physical characteristics of a regularly shaped basin. Adapted from https://directives.sc.egov.usda.gov/OpenNonWebContent.aspx?content=17755.wba

list.title: HydroBMI
list.description: Containers for all the impelmentations for the BMI.js on HydroLang

list.title: HydroBMI.BMI
list.description: "The Basic Model Interface (BMI) JavaScript specification." This language specification is derived from the Scientific Interface Definition Language (SIDL) file bmi.sidl located at https://github.com/csdms/bmi.

list.title: HydroBMI.BMIConfig
list.description: Class creator for BMI configuration file. Allows for specification or requirements easily and without need for compromises on errors. Arguments passed to the constructor depend on the type of requirements needed from HydroLang

list.title: HydroBMI.Hydro
list.description: Provides the hydro instance from HydroLang.js and other variables for usage.

list.title: Hydrolang
list.description: Main framework wrapper. Creates a new instance of all modules as objects.

list.title: HydroLangBMI
list.description: BMI implementation of the functions of HydroLang.js Creates and updates forcings and data following the models from configuration files and makes calls from other modules. If no link is added into the configuration, then an error will be raised. All instances of HydroLang will be accessible through the BMI configuration file.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.dataTypes
list.description: Returns the data types found within JS and used throughout a specific model run.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.finalize
list.description: Finalizes the requirements of a specific function.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.generateOutputs
list.description: Creates an output file downloaded to local machine with the outputs of the model results.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_component_name
list.description: Gives back a model name defined by the configuration file

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_current_time
list.description: Current time of the model

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_end_time
list.description: End time of the model.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_grid_edge_count
list.description: Get the number of edges in the grid.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_grid_edge_nodes
list.description: Get the edge-node connectivity.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_grid_face_count
list.description: Get the number of faces in the grid.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_grid_face_nodes
list.description: Returns the face-edge connectivity.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_grid_face_nodes
list.description: Returns the face-node connectivity for a grid.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_grid_node_count
list.description: Get the number of nodes in the grid.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_grid_nodes_per_face
list.description: Returns the number of nodes per face of grid.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_grid_origin
list.description: Get the origin of a grid.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_grid_shape
list.description: Get dimensions of the computational grid

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_grid_size
list.description: Get the dimensions of a computational grid.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_grid_size
list.description: Get the dimensions of a computational grid.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_grid_spacing
list.description: Get the spacing between grid nodes.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_grid_type
list.description: Get the grid type as a string.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_grid_x
list.description: Get the locations of a grid’s nodes in dimension x.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_grid_y
list.description: Get the locations of a grid’s nodes in dimension y.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_grid_z
list.description: Get the locations of a grid’s nodes in dimension z.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_input_item_count
list.description: Lets other models see the available variables included within the model

list.title: hydroLangBMI.get_input_var_names
list.description: Returns the names of the variables used as inputs for this model

list.title: hydroLangBMI.get_ouput_var_names
list.description: Returns the names of the variables used as outputs for this model

list.title: hydroLangBMI.get_output_item_count
list.description: Lets other models see the number of available variables as outputs from this model

list.title: hydroLangBMI.get_start_time
list.description: Start time of the model.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_time_step
list.description: Returns the current state of the model. For HydroLangBMI is the default time step.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_time_units
list.description: Time units of the model

list.title: hydroLangBMI.get_value
list.description: Copies the values from a variable into an array.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_value_ptr
list.description: Get a reference to the values of a given variable. Tailored towards the final implementation of the

list.title: hydroLangBMI.get_var_grid
list.description: Returns the id for the grid used in a model for a specific variable. HydroLang does not used a grid system. If implemented, uses 1 single location at '0' index.

list.title: hydroLangBMI.get_var_itemsize
list.description: Returns the size, in bytes, of a single element of a variable.

list.title: hydroLangBMI.get_var_location
list.description: Returns the location of a variable in space or time (whether input or output)

list.title: hydroLangBMI.get_var_nbytes
list.description: Provides the total amount of memory used for a variable.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.get_var_type
list.description: Returns the data type of the given variable.

list.title: hydroLangBMI.get_var_units
list.description: Returns the units of the given variable.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.handleConfig
list.description: Configuration object that creates a result based on the passed configurations to the HydroLang instance requirement. It saves any results on a result variable that is attached into the class after its called. The method runs once the HydroLangBMI class is called.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.set_value
list.description: Sets a value for an exisiting variable from an array.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.set_value_at_indices
list.description: Sets values at particular indices

list.title: HydroLangBMI.update
list.description: Update the model until a required time, Depending on the module and function required.

list.title: HydroLangBMI.update_until
list.description: Updates a model and function call depending on the requirements of the function and module called.

list.title: map
list.description: Module for mapping data.

list.title: map.addMarker
list.description: Adds a new marker to the map, given coordinates, map type and marker type.

list.title: map.draw
list.description: Adds a drawing tool functionality to an exisiting map to create layers inside.

list.title: map.geoJSON
list.description: geoJSON type renderer for Leaflet and Google Maps. It attaches point, lines, and polygon layers to a rendered map. Must be called through the Layers function passing the argument

list.title: map.kml
list.description: Creates layer of kml data passed through an object to anexisting map. Notice that the map most be already created for the method to be used.

list.title: map.Layers
list.description: Layer function for appending tiles, geodata, markers, kml or drawing tools to a map.

list.title: map.loader
list.description: Calls the map type according to the user input. The renderMap function is required for map visualization.

list.title: map.markerStyles
list.description: Creaes different styles for depending on the marker that has been selected for drawing.

list.title: map.recenter
list.description: Recenters a map at zoom of 500 m to a specific latlon.

list.title: map.renderMap
list.description: Rendering function according to the map selected by the user. Currently loads everything with the Leaflet render and OSM tile. The funciton loads the library to the header. It automatically is zoomed to 15.

list.title: module.exports.OpenStreetMap
list.description: Open Street Maps Tile Loader (English).

list.title: module.exports.OpenStreetMapDE
list.description: Open Street Maps Tile Loader (Deutsch)).

list.title: module:analyze
list.description: Module for performing data analysis. All the functions and the components are on a 3rd level chaining.

list.title: module:core
list.description: Function wrapper to be used on the Hydrolang class.

list.title: module:mapsources
list.description: Extends the map engines to be used on the map module.

list.title: nn
list.description: Main class for the creation of machine learning models using Tensorflow.

list.title: nn.convertToTensor
list.description: Converts data serving as input for either training or calculations into Tensorflow tensors.

list.title: nn.createModel
list.description: Neural network sequential model creator. Depends solely on the type of problem that the user is trying to solve and should be used accordingly.

list.title: nn.prediction
list.description: Given a trained model, uses it for calculating outputs based on raw data. The data is fed as input on the parameters and needs to be of the same size as the training data. The input data needs to be converted into a TS tensor (array) previous to be fed. The function also requires the minmax of the outputs.

list.title: nn.saveModel
list.description: Function for downloading a model that is already trained. It is saved in the user's download folder.

list.title: nn.trainModel
list.description: Trains the model given inputs and ouputs of training data. Generates weights for each expected outcome. The model can be saved in local storage using the save model function. The compilation is donw using loss function binary Cross entropy, ADAM optimizer and MSE for evaluation metric.

list.title: stat.forwardFil
list.description: Performs forward fill to replace missin values in an array with the last non-null value

list.title: stat.kurtosi
list.description: Calculates the kurtosis of a dataset

list.title: stat.skewnes
list.description: Calculates the skewness of a dataset

list.title: stats
list.description: Main class used for statistical analyses and data cleaning.

list.title: stats.arrchange
list.description: Changes a m x n matrix into a n x m matrix (transpose). Mainly used for creating google charts. M != N.

list.title: stats.autocovarianceMatrix uses the autocorrelation function inside
list.description: Still needs some testing Compute the autocovariance matrix from the autocorrelation values

list.title: stats.basicstats
list.description: Returns an array that Contains the basic statistics of a dataset. It is used afterwards to be prompted using google graphing tools.

list.title: stats.bernoulliDist
list.description: Probability mass function (PMF) of a Bernoulli distribution

list.title: stats.cleaner
list.description: Filters out items in an array that are undefined, NaN, null, ", etc.

list.title: stats.computeD
list.description: D-statistic Computes D-statistic from two samples to evaluate if they come from the same distribution Reference: Kottegoda & Rosso, 2008.

list.title: stats.copydata
list.description: Makes a deep copy of original data for further manipulation.

list.title: stats.correlation
list.description: Calculates pearson coefficient for bivariate analysis. The sets must be of the same size.

list.title: stats.datagaps
list.description: Identifies gaps in data.

list.title: stats.dateparser
list.description: Changes a 1d-date array into local strings. Used mainly for changing displaying into google charts.

list.title: stats.efficiencies
list.description: Calculates different types of efficiencies for hydrological models: Nash-Sutcliffe, Coefficient of Determination and Index of Agreement. Only accepts 1D array of observed and model data within the same time resolution. Range of validity: Nash-Sutcliffe: between 0.6-0.7 is acceptable, over 0.7 is very good. Determination coefficient: between 0 and 1, 1 being the highest with no dispersion between the data sets and 0 meaning there is no correlation. Index of agrement: between 0 and 1, with more than 0.65 being considered good. All efficiencies have limitations and showcase statistically the well performance of a model, but should not be considered as only variable for evaluation.

list.title: stats.fastfourier
list.description: Fast fourier analysis over a 1d dataset and see if there are any patterns within the data. Should be considered to be used for small data sets.

list.title: stats.flatenise
list.description: Helper function for preparing nd-JSarrays for charts and tables for duration/discharge.

list.title: stats.frequency
list.description: Calculates the frequency in data.

list.title: stats.gapfiller
list.description: Fills data gaps (either time missig or data missing). Unfinished.

list.title: stats.gapremoval
list.description: Remove gaps in data with an option to fill the gap.

list.title: stats.gaussianDist
list.description: Computes the probability density function (PDF) of a Gaussian (normal) distribution

list.title: stats.generateRandomData
list.description: Generates an array of random integers within a specified range.

list.title: stats.gevDistribution
list.description: Computes the probability density function (PDF) of the Generalized Extreme Value (GEV) distribution.

list.title: stats.interoutliers
list.description: Removes interquartile outliers from an array or a set of arrays.

list.title: stats.itemfilter
list.description: Filters out items in an array based on another array.

list.title: stats.joinarray
list.description: Preprocessing tool for joining arrays for table display.

list.title: stats.KS_computePValue
list.description: Kolmogorov Smirnov Two-sided Test Calculates the P value, based on the D-statistic from the function above. Reference: Kottegoda & Rosso, 2008.

list.title: stats.KS_rejectAtAlpha
list.description: Reject P statistic based on a significance level alpha. Reference: Kottegoda & Rosso, 2008.

list.title: stats.max
list.description: Maximum value of an array.

list.title: stats.mean
list.description: Calculates the mean of a 1d array.

list.title: stats.median
list.description: Calculates the median values for a 1d array.

list.title: stats.min
list.description: Minimum value of an array.

list.title: stats.MK
list.description: Mann-Kendall trend test Checks for mononicity of data throughout time. Reference: Kottegoda & Rosso, 2008.

list.title: stats.normalcdf
list.description: Normal distribution

list.title: stats.normalDistribution
list.description: Computes the probability density function of a normal distribution.

list.title: stats.normoutliers
list.description: Filters the outliers from the given data set based on its standard score (z-score).

list.title: stats.numerise
list.description: Turns data from numbers to strings. Usable when retrieving data or uploading data.

list.title: stats.onearray
list.description: Retrieves a 1D array with the data.

list.title: stats.outremove
list.description: Remove outliers from dataset. It uses p1 and p2 as outliers to remove.

list.title: stats.push
list.description: Pushes at the end of an array the data of another array.

list.title: stats.quantile
list.description: Quantile calculator for given data.

list.title: stats.range
list.description: Gives the range of a dataset

list.title: stats.runMonteCarlo
list.description: Generates a random simulated number when run with a dataset

list.title: stats.runSimulation
list.description: Generates a random simulated number when run with a dataset

list.title: stats.runVegas
list.description: Generates a random simulated number when run with a dataset

list.title: stats.standardize
list.description: Use mean and standard deviation to standardize the original dataset.

list.title: stats.stddev
list.description: Calculates standard deviation of a 1d array.

list.title: stats.sum
list.description: Sums all data in a 1-d array.

list.title: stats.sumsqrd
list.description: Calculates sum of squares for a dataset.

list.title: stats.timegaps
list.description: Identifies gaps in time. Used for filling gaps if required by the user. Time in minutes and timestep must be divisible by the total time of the event.

list.title: stats.unique
list.description: Unique values in an array.

list.title: stats.variance
list.description: Calculate variance for an 1-d array of data.

list.title: visualize
list.description: Module for visualization of charts and tables.

list.title: visualize.chart
list.description: Creates new charts depending on what the user requires. It can generate scatter, histograms, columns, lines, timelines, etc. It creates a new div space for each chart generated.

list.title: visualize.draw
list.description: Preset styles for both charts and tables. The user can access by passing parameters of data, type(chart or table).

list.title: visualize.prettyPrint
list.description: Returns a space in screen to visualize JSON formart objects saved in the local storage. Will be expanded to visualize other types of data.

list.title: visualize.table
list.description: Generates a new table for the data given by the user.
